alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, Bossier and Caddo. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across much of Shreveport and Bossier City. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Rainfall amounts of up to 1.50 inches have fallen across portions of South Shreveport. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Should this heavy rain persist, a Flash Flood Warning may be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Greenwood, Fosters, Forbing, Cross Lake, Barksdale Air Force Base, Robson and Taylortown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
